alert.note: Alert for Central Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 21 at 7:42AM PST until February 24 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches, with amounts up to 6 inches along the western foothills. A dusting to around an inch possible over the central portions of the Valley. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Sacramento Valley and Central Sacramento Valley Counties. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Highest snow accumulations along the far westside of the valley. Probability of 1 inch of snow is 20 to 35 percent, including Redding and Red Bluff. Probability of 2 inches of snow is 15 to 25 percent.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Central Sacramento Valley; Northern Sacramento Valley
